Title: Yusuf Gives a Royal Banquet in Honor of his Marriage
Medium: ink and pigments on cream-colored laid paper
Description: Once Yusuf, depicted here on a folio from Walters manuscript W.644 with a flaming halo and seated at the left side of the composition, received divine approval to marry Zulaykha, he organized a banquet to which he invited the Egyptian king and officials. The banquet takes place in an interior defined by two curtained windows and tiled walls with floral decoration.
Keywords: Islamic; Persian; Safavid; Book; Codex; Illumination; Illustration; Manuscript; Miniature; Painting; Contemporary Binding; Iran; Literature -- Poetry

Creator: Nur al-Din `Abd al-Rahman ibn Ahmad Jami (Persian, died 898 AH/AD 1492)
